column13: The educational institution Colegio 40091 Alma Mater De Congata is located in Congata, province of Uchumayo. The OIF provided a grant of $16,900 to cover training and materials to support classroom education sessions about electricity. This project was centred on creating functional classrooms that helped to educate students and parents on how electricity is transported, what circuits are and how they can apply learning from the classroom elsewhere. Overall, 170 students and 30 parents attended these workshops.

column13: Bohermeen bog is a raised bog listed under the European Commission Habitat Directive. It is home to a highly threatened butterfly, the Marsh Fritillary (Euphydryas aurinia), IrelandÃ¢ÂÂs only protected butterfly. While one protected species has been identified, other flora and fauna inhabiting the area could likely be species at risk of extinction. column13: This year, we co-funded a project to construct a drinking water reservoir in Arequipa, Peru. Our contribution of $38,000, along with support from the District of Uchumayo, will assist 604 residents currently without access to clean drinking water. Inputs, such as gate valves, air valves and other accessories, were delivered to complete the second drinking water line, from the groundwater collection point to the reservoirs.
